results.json_rows_response: The CTS operating results for 2019 reflected the adoption of the new revenue recognition standard in the CTS standard acquisition process. The CTS standard acquisition process includes two phases: the initial phase, during which the acquisition is completed and finalized, and the second phase, during which the acquirer receives a bid for the purchase of the acquired assets. During the first phase, the acquirer receives a bid for the acquisition of the acquired assets. The acquisition of the acquired assets is completed by the acquisition of a new plant or facility, and the new plant or facility is designated the new CTS acquisition. During the second phase, the acquirer receives a bid for the purchase of the acquired assets. The acquisition of the acquired assets is completed by the acquisition of a new plant or facility, and the new plant or facility is designated the new CTS acquisition. The gain on the sale of the acquired assets is the adjusted EBITDA of the CTS acquired assets. The adjusted EBITDA for the CTS acquired assets is $110.5 million in 2019 compared to $73.3 million in 2018.
